name: Semantic Fractal Object Axiom
intent: Define the Semantic Fractal Object (SFO) as a scale-indexed family of semantic systems with a well-defined limit capturing semantic invariants.
constraints: An SFO is a functor F: Scale \-\> SemSys where Scale is a small category of scale indices and SemSys is the category of semantic systems with structure-preserving morphisms.
For each scale index n, F(n) \= S\_n is a semantic system (X\_n, C\_n, δ\_n, Φ\_n, Π\_n, ψ\_n, A\_n).
There must exist a projective (inverse) limit Lim(F) whose elements are scale-compatible semantic states, representing semantic invariants across scales.
Scale transition maps σ\_{n-\>n+1}: S\_n \-\> S\_{n+1} must preserve the Tri-Unity structure (δ, Φ, Π) and any designated invariants.
